abstract: More than a century after the Armenian genocide, Armenian and Turkish photographers are building bridges by making pictures of daily life to underscore what they have in common.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: John Stanmeyer crouched under a rock on the border between Armenia and Turkey to avoid a rainstorm in April 2015. From his vantage point, he could make out the remains of a decaying, centuries-old bridge that once linked the two countries.
snippet: More than a century after the Armenian genocide, Armenian and Turkish photographers are building bridges by making pictures of daily life to underscore what they have in common....

headline.main: Building Bridges Between Turkey and Armenia
